content: प्रदिश् {c6c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To point out, indicate, show, assign; तस्याधिकारपुरुषैः प्रणतैः प्रदिष्टां <ls>R. 5. 63</ls>; <ls n="R.">2. 39.</ls> {@--2@} To tell, mention, communicate; <ls>Bg. 8. 28</ls>; <ls>Bk. 4. 5.</ls> {@--3@} To give, grant, offer, bestow or confer upon; विद्ययोः पथि मुनिप्रदिष्टयोः <ls>R. 11. 9</ls>; <ls n="R.">7. 35</ls>; निःशब्दोऽपि प्रदिशसि जलं याचितश्चातकेभ्यः <ls>Me. 114</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 265.</ls> {@--4@} To direct, prescribe, ordain. {@--5@} To signify, declare, make known. {@--6@} To urge on, incite.

प्रदिश् {%<ab>f.</ab>%} {@--1@} Pointing out. {@--2@} An order, direction, command. {@--3@} A direction, quarter. {@--4@} An intermediate point of the compass; such as नैरृती, आग्नेयी, ऐशानी and वायवी.
